title: About
text: Hey! My name is Logan Young-Glenn and I am a student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am currently a junior, with a major in Sports Media and Communications in the College of Journalism. A few interesting things about me are that I grew up in Lincoln and I have worked at the Country Club of Lincoln as a player services member over the past three years.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Did the Virginia Cavaliers Deserve to Make the 2024 NCAA Tournament?
text:
This is a test to see if i can type in this jit


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggbeeswarm)
library(wehoop)

net <- read_csv("netwl.csv")


Rows: 100 Columns: 14
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (10): SCHOOL, CONFERENCE, RECORD, ROAD, NEUTRAL, HOME, QUAD 1, QUAD 2, Q...
dbl  (4): RANK, PREVIOUS, QUAD 1+2 W, QUAD 3+4 L

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
kenpom <- read_csv("kenpomwl.csv")


New names:
Rows: 100 Columns: 22
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(2): Team, Conf dbl (20): Rk, W, L, AdjEM...6, AdjO, ...8, AdjD, ...10, AdjT,
...12, Luck, ....
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...6`
• `` -> `...8`
• `` -> `...10`
• `` -> `...12`
• `` -> `...14`
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...15`
• `` -> `...16`
• `` -> `...18`
• `` -> `...20`
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...21`
• `` -> `...22`


Code
teams <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")
tourneyteam <- c("Virginia","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")
nontourneyteam <- c("Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblet <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% teams) 

madeit <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% tourneyteam)

nitbound <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% nontourneyteam)

vi <- kenpom |>
  filter( Team == "Virginia")

ggplot() +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=vi, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#F84C1E",
                      alpha = 1) +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=nitbound, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#009CDE",
                      alpha = 1)  +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=nitbound,
    aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, label=Team)) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=vi,aes(x=AdjO + .2, y=AdjD, label=Team)
  ) +
  labs(x="Offensive Efficiency", y="Defensive Efficiency", title="Adjusted Efficiency Between Virginia and Non-Tournament Teams", subtitle="Look where Virginia falls amongst these teams in terms of efficiency!", caption="Source: Kenpom | By Logan Young-Glenn") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text( size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  ) 


Scale for size is already present.
Adding another scale for size, which will replace the existing scale.











Code
sportsref <- read_csv("sportsref.csv")


Rows: 362 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): School
dbl (28): Rk, G, W, L, W-L%, SRS, SOS, Conf. W, Conf. L, Home W, Home L, Awa...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
head(sportsref)


# A tibble: 6 × 29
     Rk School             G     W     L `W-L%`    SRS   SOS `Conf. W` `Conf. L`
  <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
1     1 Abilene Chris…    34    16    18  0.471  -4.12 -1.12        10        10
2     2 Air Force         31     9    22  0.29   -4.77  1.43         2        16
3     3 Akron             35    24    11  0.686   2.77 -2.08        13         5
4     4 Alabama           37    25    12  0.676  20.7  11.8         13         5
5     5 Alabama A&M       35    12    23  0.343 -14.4  -7.52         9         9
6     6 Alabama State     32    13    19  0.406 -11.7  -6.87         8        10
# ℹ 19 more variables: `Home W` <dbl>, `Home L` <dbl>, `Away W` <dbl>,
#   `Away L` <dbl>, `Points Tm.` <dbl>, `Points Opp.` <dbl>, Pace <dbl>,
#   ORtg <dbl>, FTr <dbl>, `3PAr` <dbl>, `TS%` <dbl>, `TRB%` <dbl>,
#   `AST%` <dbl>, `STL%` <dbl>, `BLK%` <dbl>, `eFG%` <dbl>, `TOV%` <dbl>,
#   `ORB%` <dbl>, `FT/FGA` <dbl>


Code
schoolsr <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana State","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblesr <- sportsref |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% schoolsr)

head(bubblesr)


# A tibble: 6 × 29
     Rk School     G     W     L `W-L%`   SRS   SOS `Conf. W` `Conf. L` `Home W`
  <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
1    51 Cinci…    37    22    15  0.595  15.1  8.49         7        11       16
2   123 India…    39    32     7  0.821  13.4  2.26        17         3       16
3   224 Oklah…    32    20    12  0.625  14.7  8.07         8        10       14
4   235 Pitts…    33    22    11  0.667  14.9  6.92        12         8       13
5   241 Provi…    35    21    14  0.6    12.6  8.93        10        10       14
6   268 Seton…    37    25    12  0.676  12.7  8.8         13         7       17
# ℹ 18 more variables: `Home L` <dbl>, `Away W` <dbl>, `Away L` <dbl>,
#   `Points Tm.` <dbl>, `Points Opp.` <dbl>, Pace <dbl>, ORtg <dbl>, FTr <dbl>,
#   `3PAr` <dbl>, `TS%` <dbl>, `TRB%` <dbl>, `AST%` <dbl>, `STL%` <dbl>,
#   `BLK%` <dbl>, `eFG%` <dbl>, `TOV%` <dbl>, `ORB%` <dbl>, `FT/FGA` <dbl>


Code
bigmbb <- sportsref |> 
  filter(School %in% bubblesr)|>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  group_by(School) |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS)) 

tbl <- bubblesr |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  mutate_at(vars(-School), as.numeric) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS))

 tbl |> gt() |>
  cols_label(
    School = "Team",
    SRS = "Simple Rating",
    SOS = "Schedule Strength",
    W = "Wins",
    L = "Losses"
  )|>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Logan Young-Glenn  |  **Source:** [Sports Reference](https://www.sports-reference.com/cbb/seasons/men/2024-advanced-school-stats.html)")
  )|>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   )|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#232D4B"),
      cell_text(color = "#F84C1E")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = School == "Virginia")
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How Does Virginia Compare to Teams That Did Not Make the Tournament?",
    subtitle = "The Cavaliers are dead last in simple rating compared to these teams on the opposite side of the bubble! Virginia's strength of schedule is also not a standout amongst the group. "
  )

Code
conf <- read_csv("srconf.csv")


Rows: 362 Columns: 30
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): School, Conference
dbl (28): Rk, G, W, L, W-L%, SRS, SOS, Conf. W, Conf. L, Home W, Home L, Awa...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
tourneyt <- c("Virginia","Colorado State","Wagner","Howard","Grambling","Montana State","Oakland","Kentucky","Michigan State","Mississippi State","Duquesne","Brigham Young","Akron","Creighton","Long Beach State","Arizona","North Carolina","Morehead State","Illinois","Oregon","Soutch Carolina","Nevada","Dayton","South Dakota State","Texas","Iowa State","Mcneese State","Gonzaga","Saint Peter's","Tennessee","NC State","Texas Tech","Drake","Washinghton State","Samford","Kansas","Texas A&M","Nebraska","Northwestern","Florida Atlantic","Colgate","Baylor","UAB","San Diego State","Western Kentucky","Marquette","New Mexico","Clemson","Stetson","Connecticut","Yale","Auburn","Colorado","Florida","Vermont","Duke","Purdue","Charleston","Alabama","Houston","Longwood","James Madison","Wisconsin","TCU","Utah State","Grand Canyon","Saint Mary's","Boise State")
schoolsrc <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana State","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall", "Providence")

conferences <- c("ACC", "BTEN", "BIG12", "PAC12", "BE", "MWC")

vcc <- c("Virginia")

virgin <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% vcc)

head(conf)


# A tibble: 6 × 30
     Rk School        Conference     G     W     L `W-L%`    SRS   SOS `Conf. W`
  <dbl> <chr>         <chr>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>
1     1 Abilene Chri… WAC           34    16    18  0.471  -4.12 -1.12        10
2     2 Air Force     MWC           31     9    22  0.29   -4.77  1.43         2
3     3 Akron         MAC           35    24    11  0.686   2.77 -2.08        13
4     4 Alabama       SEC           37    25    12  0.676  20.7  11.8         13
5     5 Alabama A&M   SWAC          35    12    23  0.343 -14.4  -7.52         9
6     6 Alabama State SWAC          32    13    19  0.406 -11.7  -6.87         8
# ℹ 20 more variables: `Conf. L` <dbl>, `Home W` <dbl>, `Home L` <dbl>,
#   `Away W` <dbl>, `Away L` <dbl>, `Points Tm.` <dbl>, `Points Opp.` <dbl>,
#   Pace <dbl>, ORtg <dbl>, FTr <dbl>, `3PAr` <dbl>, `TS%` <dbl>, `TRB%` <dbl>,
#   `AST%` <dbl>, `STL%` <dbl>, `BLK%` <dbl>, `eFG%` <dbl>, `TOV%` <dbl>,
#   `ORB%` <dbl>, `FT/FGA` <dbl>


Code
tourn <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% tourneyt) |>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

power <- conf|>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

otourn <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% schoolsrc)|>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

ggplot() + 
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=power, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="#009CDE") +
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=tourn, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="grey") +
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=virgin, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="#F84C1E") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=virgin,
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference, label=School)) +
  labs(x="Conference", y="Simple Rating", title="Virginia's Simple Rating Compared to Other Power Conference Teams", subtitle="Virginia is trailing other power conference teams who didn't make the tournament.", caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Logan Young-Glenn") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text( size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

title: Introduction
text: Hey! My name is Logan Young-Glenn and I am a student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am currently a junior, with a major in Sports Media and Communications in the College of Journalism. A few interesting things about me are that I grew up in Lincoln and I have worked at the Country Club of Lincoln as a player services member over the past three years.

title: Did the Virginia Cavaliers Deserve to Make the 2024 NCAA Tournament?
text:
This is a test to see if i can type in this jit


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggbeeswarm)
library(wehoop)

net <- read_csv("netwl.csv")
kenpom <- read_csv("kenpomwl.csv")

teams <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")
tourneyteam <- c("Virginia","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")
nontourneyteam <- c("Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblet <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% teams) 

madeit <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% tourneyteam)

nitbound <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% nontourneyteam)

vi <- kenpom |>
  filter( Team == "Virginia")

ggplot() +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=vi, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#F84C1E",
                      alpha = 1) +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=nitbound, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#009CDE",
                      alpha = 1)  +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=nitbound,
    aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, label=Team)) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=vi,aes(x=AdjO + .2, y=AdjD, label=Team)
  ) +
  labs(x="Offensive Efficiency", y="Defensive Efficiency", title="Adjusted Efficiency Between Virginia and Non-Tournament Teams", subtitle="Look where Virginia falls amongst these teams in terms of efficiency!", caption="Source: Kenpom | By Logan Young-Glenn") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text( size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

schoolsr <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana State","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblesr <- sportsref |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% schoolsr)

Code
bigmbb <- sportsref |> 
  filter(School %in% bubblesr)|>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  group_by(School) |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS)) 

tbl <- bubblesr |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  mutate_at(vars(-School), as.numeric) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS))

 tbl |> gt() |>
  cols_label(
    School = "Team",
    SRS = "Simple Rating",
    SOS = "Schedule Strength",
    W = "Wins",
    L = "Losses"
  )|>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Logan Young-Glenn  |  **Source:** [Sports Reference](https://www.sports-reference.com/cbb/seasons/men/2024-advanced-school-stats.html)")
  )|>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   )|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#232D4B"),
      cell_text(color = "#F84C1E")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = School == "Virginia")
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How Does Virginia Compare to Teams That Did Not Make the Tournament?",
    subtitle = "The Cavaliers are dead last in simple rating compared to these teams on the opposite side of the bubble! Virginia's strength of schedule is also not a standout amongst the group. "
  )

Code
conf <- read_csv("srconf.csv")

tourneyt <- c("Virginia","Colorado State","Wagner","Howard","Grambling","Montana State","Oakland","Kentucky","Michigan State","Mississippi State","Duquesne","Brigham Young","Akron","Creighton","Long Beach State","Arizona","North Carolina","Morehead State","Illinois","Oregon","Soutch Carolina","Nevada","Dayton","South Dakota State","Texas","Iowa State","Mcneese State","Gonzaga","Saint Peter's","Tennessee","NC State","Texas Tech","Drake","Washinghton State","Samford","Kansas","Texas A&M","Nebraska","Northwestern","Florida Atlantic","Colgate","Baylor","UAB","San Diego State","Western Kentucky","Marquette","New Mexico","Clemson","Stetson","Connecticut","Yale","Auburn","Colorado","Florida","Vermont","Duke","Purdue","Charleston","Alabama","Houston","Longwood","James Madison","Wisconsin","TCU","Utah State","Grand Canyon","Saint Mary's","Boise State")
schoolsrc <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana State","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall", "Providence")

conferences <- c("ACC", "BTEN", "BIG12", "PAC12", "BE", "MWC")

vcc <- c("Virginia")

virgin <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% vcc)

head(conf)

Code
tourn <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% tourneyt) |>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

power <- conf|>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

otourn <- conf |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% schoolsrc)|>
  filter( Conference %in% conferences)

ggplot() + 
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=power, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="#009CDE") +
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=tourn, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="grey") +
  geom_beeswarm(
    data=virgin, 
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference), color="#F84C1E") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=virgin,
    aes(x=SRS, y=Conference, label=School)) +
  labs(x="Conference", y="Simple Rating", title="Virginia's Simple Rating Compared to Other Power Conference Teams", subtitle="Virginia is trailing other power conference teams who didn't make the tournament.", caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Logan Young-Glenn") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text( size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )
